alert.note: Alert for Des Moines (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued May 25 at 6:27PM CDT until May 25 at 6:45PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: The National Weather Service in the Quad Cities has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Southwestern Des Moines County in southeastern Iowa... * Until 645 PM CDT. * At 627 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Middletown, or 8 miles west of Burlington, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This dangerous storm will be near... Danville, Beaverdale and Starr`s Cave Park and Preserve around 635 PM CDT. Prairie Grove around 640 PM CDT. Big Hollow Recreation Area, Pleasant Grove, Dodgeville and Sperry around 645 PM CDT. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
